website_summaries.verdict: For inconspicuous and quick street shooting or as a travel camera for landscape fans, the Ricoh GR II hits the mark. But If you want video or the shooting-angle flexibility that a movable LCD or viewfinder provides, this may not be the camera for you.
pros: The lightweight, compact Ricoh GR II is well designed, and its APS-C sensor allows for shallower depth-of-field than do the smaller sensors in competitors
And while it lacks breadth in its features, it does provide depth when it comes to still photos
cons: Slow autofocus focus in dim light, poor video quality with zero controls, and a relatively complicated menu system given its features dim its allure

customer_reviews.title: This is the best camera I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I have ever owned. I use it for street/travel photography and it is a BEAST. Great for macro shots as well. I recommend setting the camera to P Mode, ISO 1600, SNAP focus at 2.5m for documentary style shooting. The camera is very customizable as well. You can't go wrong with this pocketable powerhouse. (Auto focus is slow and lacking, however the SNAP focus option more than makes up for this)
customer_reviews.author: Tammy C.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about these years ago
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than expected. Actually fits in a pocket. Very quick to start and focus, even set up was very quick. But the pictures really speak for themselves. You will not believe the image quality that comes from this camera. Physically, not too small. Easy to use. Wanted a light camera with great image quality to hike with. Definitely found it here.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zilic

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive, takes incredible photos and the best part, it slips right into my pants pocket.
customer_reviews.text: I originally owned an X100T and actually really enjoyed it. But I found myself not bringing it with me unless there was some specific reason. It was bulky. The Ricoh GR and GR ii just works. It's intuitive, takes incredible photos and the best part, it slips right into my pants pocket. Hit 'snap' mode and shoot away. I also looked at the X70, which looks old-school as well but again, the lens popping out made it seem a bit bulky as well (plus the $100 price difference). I'm now just a GR fan.
customer_reviews.author: Justin L.

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the quality of the photos from this camera. It has an ASP-C image sensor so the pictures are plenty large enough to crop and print. The colors are a bit washed out but the RAW files are a dream to edit and maintain a lot of color and dynamic range. This is the perfect travel and hiking camera. Just as long as you don't intend to use this for video because the video is almost useless. This is a photography camera not a video camera, so if you want high quality video look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Not my Canon 5D but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic camera! Yes, it's not DSLR in extreme conditions when you want the fast auto focus or the 300mm zoom range, but is just a perfect camera for what is intended to be. You only need your right hand to operate it, it's size is great to carry in your pocket and discrete for street shooting, useful also in places around the world that you might not feel safe shooting with expensive equipment. It does not replace a DSLR, it's a different tool, a camera you take where you don't want to carry your big guns and any fancy $1000 smart phone does not do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice picture quality
customer_reviews.text: If you need a camera that's better than you phone and small enough to carry in your bag it's worth considering. The controls are complex until you get it under control. And it's pricey. The small size and the black color make it easy to lose. I'm on my second one of these. Considering the price...It's a big thing to lose. The wifi is garbage. The included cable works well with a laptop. Getting the photos to your phone or IPad is a multi step process. There are prob cables that will go from cam to phone It does black and white really well.
customer_reviews.author: Roch McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I've been wanting a Ricoh GR for a while (multiple years) and finally when I downgraded my iPhone from a 7+ to an SE, I splurged on the GR II to take over for my snapshots. It does what it's supposed to and I'm pretty happy with that. It's not a replacement for a larger camera, but when I'm traveling for work (and I work in the photo/advertising world) I'm not going to lug around something with interchangeable lenses in a separate bag or on my shoulder all day long. This Ricoh fits in my pocket and you can take it anywhere with you, which is 90% of its appeal to me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Image quality is really good, the unit is light weight and easily pocketable ...
customer_reviews.text: Ricoh GRIV was my trusted sidekick for nearly 5 years and wanted an upgrade. I wanted the precise same form factor and GR II filled it. Image quality is really good, the unit is light weight and easily pocketable for the back streets of any city on earth. One of the most underrated cameras in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Anuran

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the GR III originally, but soon found myself missing the built-in flash from the previous models. So I returned the GR III and bought the II instead. Excellent lens, great color and contrast, and the built-in flash makes a great fill light.
customer_reviews.author: radioguy17

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, some issues
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compact camera. Great image quality, and the wifi to my phone works perfectly with the Ricoh app. Image quality is superb. This is a fantastic pocketable travel camera, and the best for street photography. Ergonomics are better than any camera I've used - love the one-handed operation. Sensor dust can still be an issue, so I'd like to see better sealing on the next iteration. That being said, I'm happy live with spot healing a bit here and there in post if it means I get this IQ in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: BCW

customer_reviews.title: I used less than 2 years. And now it doesn’t works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this end of 2016. I really love this camera before last week. I like this camera’s filter effect and easy to use. I only use at home for my makeup picture and gentle used. BTW! It doesn’t turned on suddenly. I don’t know why I charged camera and trying to turn on the lens is coming up but not working anymore. So I’m trying to repair estimate. They said don’t know why and will be charge 212.5$. What?? New Camera is 600$ around. I love this cameras picture but I don’t know I need to repait it. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Jun Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera and Excellent buy if you do street photography, macro photography. This is a Grea
customer_reviews.text: Best super compact camera for the money, easy to use interface with all menues on one page, control are easy to understand and features that your DLSR have on a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Eurquhart

customer_reviews.title: A superb compact camera,
customer_reviews.text: A superb compact camera, the best I've shot with. The b/w photos are terrific, as are the color images produced in available natural light. The one-handed operation is a massive bonus. I was quite pleasantly surprised at the ergonomics and customization options of this little giant, and I am enjoying photography again. You won't turn into Garry Winogrand because of the GR II, but it's a damn nice camera, with a very sharp little lens. Yes, every awe-stricken review of this camera is true.
customer_reviews.author: The jazz cat

customer_reviews.title: Better than GR III
customer_reviews.text: So they changed both the sensor and the lens design for GR III... I had both, kept the GR II. There is some kind of magic to GR II pictures. They look clear and beautiful. Some say it’s the perfect combination of the sensor and the lens. I see it in my pics. I see it in gallery samples on Amazon and on dpreview. GR II is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei C

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I ever bought. Good price, great value. Like one time it accidentally experienced some water damage, and before I made my mind to buy a new one if fixed itself! I'm impressed. The filters are amazing. This camera can take have the style/vibe some DSLR can't even have. I've already sold my DSLR. The small body makes it ideal to carry with you like everywhere. The only problem is that you can't zoom in or zoom out, like you have to get so close to a model's face, can't get objects that are far away.
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: I still think my Fuji mirrorless cameras take better photos, but these are good and the camera ...
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself a camera enthusiast. This is my first time shooting with the Ricoh. Enjoying the images, size, and ease of use. I still think my Fuji mirrorless cameras take better photos, but these are good and the camera serves its purpose for me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Malveaux

customer_reviews.title: The camera I received had a very annoying defect that showed yellow tinting
customer_reviews.text: The camera I received had a very annoying defect that showed yellow tinting. I requested another and it had the exact same issue again with the replacement. Otherwise from the poor quality control, the pictures are very nice! For those who receive good copies, I doubt you'll hate the image quality!
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: A really special camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has its quirks - luckily I never really experienced many. For example dust getting inside can be a problem, but at the end of the day its something that can be avoided or just wont bother you. Its a great camera and the image quality is fantastic for the size. I think look wise it seems like a cheap point and shoot that you buy from those shady camera stores in the mall - but the reality is it shoots proper raw photos that look like they came from a bigger DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: BobBob

customer_reviews.title: Best street photography camera even today, for wide angle photographers.
customer_reviews.text: This is simply one of the very best street photography cameras around, even today in 2018. If you are a street photographer and you like shooting wide angle, this camera has your name on it.
customer_reviews.author: Raist3d

customer_reviews.title: highly rated but am not that impressed
customer_reviews.text: images are good but no wow moments very very disappointed frustrated poed to find the original firmware ver on a camera i bought recently was this camera gathering cobwebs somewhere for years!!! app won’t work then bought a non oem app which also fails to connect with the camera so my task ahead is how to update the camera to the latest firmware other...Note this camera lens is not for the casual user or for family use! Some degree of telephoto lens is essential if this is to be your sole compact camera
customer_reviews.author: D Do

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality photos
customer_reviews.text: What a good camera! Focusing is quick and seems to work well in low light. Very sharp pictures, unique really good controls. Works in low light and high ISO. I can take good pictures in low light with no flash. Even when there is some noise, detail is largely retained. I also own a long zoom compact camera. The two cameras take care of all my photography needs.
customer_reviews.author: Frash

customer_reviews.title: THE FLASH IS TO DIE FOR
customer_reviews.text: oof best point n shoot ever. the flash is what got me. i cannot emphasize this enough- the flash is sooooo good. it’s the retro-y kinda flash. my fave setting is “positive film” with flash. ugh my forever camera.
customer_reviews.author: ed rihanna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's an advanced enthusiasts' camera with an APS-C sensor - everything I expected.
customer_reviews.author: wsang

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best pocketable camera with APSC sensor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera about 18 months ago. This is one of the best pocketable camera with APSC sensor. The built in RAW photo processor works great. User interface is very intuitive (yes, I am a geek). I have Canon full-frame cameras with several L lenses, which I use when I plan photography trip, this camera I can keep with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ziist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect On the Go.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for on-the-go street photography. Went with the 2nd gen for the tactile controls and lack of touchscreen, purely a personal preference. I cannot recommend this camera highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: Wyeuca

customer_reviews.title: Little but powerful camera.
customer_reviews.text: Auto focus can be slow in low light. Noise with not too high iso 1600. Very convenient controlling features - even more powerful than my canon EOS t7i.
customer_reviews.author: helloworld

customer_reviews.title: Legendary
customer_reviews.text: It does few things, but those few things are VERY important....and it does them EXCEPTIONALLY well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing.
customer_reviews.text: ide buy it again if it fails its shutter count.. sucks its only 16mp but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SCOOBY

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Great images from this camera. The lens is sharp and I like the image quality, especially in black and white. Small and lightweight but feels well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Olson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish the flash was stronger but otherwise a capable street cam.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Manzano

customer_reviews.title: One of the best street cameras you can get.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely my main go to for street photography, but a good second body for landscaping as well. It's a bit pricey but worth every penny. I wouldn't recommend this camera to beginners or being your only camera unless you love the style and are strictly into street photography.
customer_reviews.author: Gen J

customer_reviews.title: Clear photos
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with smaller pocket fit cameras where if you moved even slightly the photo lacked in clarity. That doesn't seem to happen with the Ricoh GR 11. Great for street shooting and being a none intrusive photographer. I am glad I bought this camera and plan on using it more and more because it is handy.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great street shooter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent one handed ergonomics, best picture quality (APS-C sensor) from a compact sized camera.
customer_reviews.author: mbs47

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: Autofocus is not so great even worst at lowlight. Still a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL PHILLIP GAHIT

customer_reviews.title: Nothing
customer_reviews.text: It is as I expected it to be. I will use it for street photography. I would be more happy if there was a screen protector included in the box which I had to buy later and paid postage for it.
customer_reviews.author: Erol Dagyaran

customer_reviews.title: Great compliment to X100F
customer_reviews.text: As the new owner of both the Fuji X100F and the Ricoh GR ii I can honestly say it's like choosing a favorite child. I just love them both differently and for different reasons.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceBarZ

customer_reviews.title: Charge problem and dirt on it
customer_reviews.text: I received a power plug with 3 head like this? And they didn’t send me a 2 head one. Looks like some dirt in the lens.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great seller.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, great seller. Had an issue with the camera and needed to return, seller had a new one to me in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Hope this gives you the confidence that these amazing cameras deserve
customer_reviews.text: I've had both the GR and the GRII. Both are always in my daily work bag. The GR didn't even have a sleeve on it and I had it for almost 1.5 years. But it was always zipped in the one of the most secure pouches of the bag. It's travelled with me to more than 8 countries. Dust concern: I've never experienced dust but only read about it in online forums. Now I carry the GRII with a sleeve. Also, I sold the GR to a friend who was extremely impressed by it. I didn't sell it cause it had dust or flaws. Hope this gives you the confidence that these amazing cameras deserve. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Vipin K.

customer_reviews.title: I actually really really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera feels very light in the hand and I've only used it a few times so far, but it takes great pictures! I take pictures under low light settings and found that the pictures are clear, there is almost no lag in auto-focus/shutter speed and I feel confident about using this as my main camera wherever I go because it's so portable. I would highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Y. K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy itw
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it except the auto focus ain't so accurate when it is too dark.
customer_reviews.author: Adams

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love the colors and textures of the photos
customer_reviews.author: liuxuluo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Small but powerfull. No need to cary heavy bıg camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa Gokdogan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera. It does everything in the reviews and ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. It does everything in the reviews and more. Remote control the camera from your iPhone. Even remotely look through the viewfinder to set up difficult shots. Takes the selfie to a whole new level. Love!
customer_reviews.author: D. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Very light and easy to use and its positive mode is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a great camera for your everyday use, super light and perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera. If you have the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. If you have the money, get it. Not much of difference from the older model, get that one if you are tight on money.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: insane macro slow start up
customer_reviews.text: macro function is out of control awesome. takes way too long to start up and doesnt read the SD card right away though. i graduated to the ricoh gr II and absolutely love it (although macro is not as good as the GR II digital).
customer_reviews.author: samueltlogan

customer_reviews.title: The camera is awesome except for the Wifi feature
customer_reviews.text: The camera is awesome except for the Wifi feature. The App they have that syncs with this is super clunky and slow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to deal with
customer_reviews.text: THIS made my year; easy to deal with... amazing product; and, fab pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photo quality
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my trip to Vietnam. Amazing photo quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: The best APS-C compact camera in the world
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I already had the GR I. The reason I bought this one was that the increase in shots per second helps getting a good one when shooting my kids. Ricoh GR I is a gem. The GR II is another
customer_reviews.author: C. G. D. V

customer_reviews.title: Images quality is rich and crisp.
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular images quality and sharpness. much richer crisper images than my canon 60d, with any one of my lenses. Highly recommend the camera. If you buy the camera, get an extra battery. Image attached is unedited, straight from the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Set exposure easily
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ! Set exposure easily. Nice tonal values. Happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile gem
customer_reviews.text: The multiple settings and features on such a compact APS-C sensor camera makes the GRII well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little camera
customer_reviews.text: I shoot DSLR, 35mm slr, 120 medium format, I love digital and film, to each its own. Im very happy with this camera, easier and more versatile to shoot than my Canon 7d (albeit you only have the 28mm perspective), quality is amazing, low light focusing can be challenging but not impossible, daylight focusing much better than my canon 7d. I don't care for the video, if that's what you want look elsewhere. This is a photography machine. Overall a very nice camera that allows you to be able to shoot anywhere anytime because it fits right into any jacket pocket, some pants.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer0068

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the equivalent of a police officers back up gun. The picture quality of out of this world. The interface is perfect and professional.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera so much. I'm not a pro. I mainly take pics of my kids and cats, but I like to dabble in some other things. I took it to Jamaica last month and was very pleased. I didn't feel like I stood out carrying a big dslr. I had my stealthy, but powerful little camera. It takes such nice, sharp photos.
customer_reviews.author: W. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: It is an excellent camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I definitely agree with the most other reviewers. It is an excellent camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: JAE MYUNG

customer_reviews.title: It takes great pictures that you'll be proud of
customer_reviews.text: A special camera indeed. It takes great pictures that you'll be proud of.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo Pacoli

customer_reviews.title: perfect compliment to my main camera
customer_reviews.text: perfect compliment to my main camera. perfect for situations like the beach where you're worried about sand and water, hiking where you need something light, foreign places where you might exercise common sense, and everyday carry. the sensor is big enough and pictures come out really nice. imo, better than my previous setup like sony's rx100 or even my old leica x type 113 since it is far smaller and pocketable. if i have to complain at one thing, it would be the web based app called gr remote. i wish it is native to ios.
customer_reviews.author: DarkMaN

customer_reviews.title: I like the camera very much though
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera very much though, it's small, light, convenient. However, there's a black spot on my sensor the 10 day after I bought it. And for this kind of camera, the dot on the sensor it impossible to remove by myself. I've returned and thinking about whether I should get a new one or not.
customer_reviews.author: Shirly

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to see what's on the screen when you are taking pictures outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Ricoh GR II Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:BaseBuilding upon an award winning series, the RICOH GR II categorically redesigns the digital compact camera with its newly developed wide-angle lens and 16-megapixel APS-C size image sensor, all built into one of the smallest bodies in its class. Not only does the GR feature a larger sensor, its anti-aliasing filter-less design and fast 28mm equivalent F2.8 lens make for incredible, high-sensitivity, professional-grade imagery. In addition to high-speed autofocus improvements and onboard Wi-Fi compatibility, enjoy DSLR-like handling and functionality with full 1080 HD video capture capabilities. Whether you’re looking for a second body to count on as a trusty sidekick, or simply want big pictures from a small camera, the GR II will redefine your photography.
feature_bullets: Battery Life(Approximately) 320 shots for Still image or 190 minutes for Playback or 45 minutes for recording movies; Continuous shooting approximately 4 frame per second

The GR II comes equipped with Wi Fi functions for wireless connection with mobile devices such as smartphones and tablet computers; It is also compatible with NFC (Near Field Communication) functions for easy pairing with mobile devices

The advanced GR ENGINE V imaging engine offers high sensitivity shooting with minimal noise and the GR II’s anti aliasing filter less design produces supremely high resolution, color rich images; Total Pixels: Approx 16.9 megapixels
Capture both JPG and open standard DNG RAW images; The GR II offers a variety of computer free image processing functions, including in body RAW data development to output JPEG format files

Capture full HD video in widescreen 1080p resolution with h.264 compression @ 30 frames per second; The Auto focus system remains active with movement as the camera continuously focuses subjects in the center of its angle of view; Lens Construction :7 elements in 5 groups (2 aspherical lens elements)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars164 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
